title: Grief & Loss
subtitle: Moving through what can't be fixed
description: A compassionate guide to processing grief—whether from death, divorce, job loss, or the ending of who you used to be. Learn to feel fully, honor what was lost, and eventually find your way forward.

modules.title: Understanding Grief
modules.description: What grief is, how it works, and why we avoid it

modules.title: Types of Loss
modules.description: Death, divorce, identity, dreams—the many faces of grief

modules.title: Allowing Grief to Move
modules.description: Somatic practices for feeling and releasing grief

modules.title: Complicated Grief
modules.description: When grief gets stuck or tangled

modules.title: Rebuilding Meaning
modules.description: Finding your way forward after loss

whatYouLearn: Understand grief as a healthy process, not a problem
Recognize different types of loss that require mourning
Use somatic practices to move grief through the body
Identify when grief is complicated or stuck
Create meaningful rituals for honoring loss
Begin rebuilding life and meaning after loss
requirements: Currently experiencing loss or processing past losses
No timeline pressure - work at your own pace

questions.question: What is grief?
options: A natural response to loss that needs to be felt and processed

questions.question: What types of loss can trigger grief?
options: Death, divorce, job loss, identity changes, lost dreams, and more
Nothing should cause grief if you're strong

questions.question: Why does grief often live in the body?
options: It doesn't - grief is purely emotional
Unexpressed grief gets held as tension, heaviness, or numbness in the body
Only physical losses affect the body

questions.question: What is 'complicated grief'?
options: Grief that gets stuck, often due to unfinished business, ambivalence, or trauma

questions.question: Why are rituals helpful in grief?
options: They provide structure for acknowledging loss and supporting the transition

questions.question: What does 'rebuilding meaning' after loss involve?
options: Integrating the loss into a new sense of self and life purpose

questions.question: When should you seek professional support for grief?
options: When grief significantly impairs functioning or feels stuck for extended periods
Immediately - you can't do grief alone
